sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visits the Sumy Oblast, one year on after Russia withdrew its troops on the ground, but Moscow continues to shell the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The group Nuclear Weapons Ban Monitor says Russia and China are mostly to blame for an increase in the world's nuclear weapons arsenal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Protests continue in Israel despite a pause to a controversial plan to overhaul the country's legal system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The European Commission's transport department chief has resigned from his position over a scandal involving free flights from Qatar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A group of elderly women take the Swiss government to the European Court of Human Rights for harming them with their climate change policies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: King Charles has arrived in Germany in his first state visit abroad since becoming British monarch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's the nearest Ukraine's president has been to the border with Russia since the beginning of the full-scale invasion of his country in February 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Volodymyr Zelensky visited the northeastern Sumy region to mark the anniversary of its recapture from Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the early weeks of the conflict, several towns there became the focus of fierce battles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russian forces, however, are continuing to shell the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They hit the town of Bilopilya on Tuesday morning, damaging a school building and an apartment block.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, there are signs of war damage being repaired.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The town of Stargi Saltiv in Ukraine's Kharkiv Oblast bears heavy traces of the war. A small number of civilians in the town are trying to survive among the ruins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On the diplomatic front, Ukraine's foreign minister has taken part in a virtual session in the US-led Summit for Democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: No other nation wants peace more than Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But peace at any cost is an illusion. For peace to be a lasting one it needs to be just. The cessation of Russia's aggression and the restoration of Ukraine's territorial integrity are essential conditions for peace. Russia says it's willing to talk peace but stresses its security concerns come first.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Wednesday, the group Nuclear Weapons Ban Monitor warned that the global arsenal of nuclear weapons is increasing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: If all the world's weapons were used, the effect would be equal to 135,000 Hiroshima-sized catastrophes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That was the last nuclear attack when the United States bombed the Japanese city of Hiroshima in 1945.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Last year, 9,440 warheads were ready to use.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That number's now 9,576.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There are nine nuclear states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: down 9,576. There are nine nuclear states. And in its report, the group blames China and Russia for producing most of this year's additional nuclear weapons. Meanwhile, the war in Ukraine has increased the possibility of a nuclear conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators gathered in Jerusalem to protest talks on the government's controversial judicial

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: overhaul plan that has divided the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Israeli President Isaac Herzog has offered to mediate negotiations between political leaders to find a solution to the country's worst political crisis in decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The talks followed widespread protests, which forced Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to announce a pause in his plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But skepticism around the overhaul remains high among those who've been on the streets for weeks, decrying the move which they say threatens Israel's democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: I don't believe our prime minister and I don't believe that there's any negotiations on the very basic values of democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The overhaul would curtail the authority of the Supreme Court and give politicians greater powers over the selection of judges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Despite widespread criticism, the move has strong support among far-right voters and religious Israelis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We came here to say that this is our country, we chose it, we chose it in the heart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: A government that will change the entire system of law, that will make a proper reform, that will improve the people, a government that has 64 mandates. The plan's backers argue that changes are needed to rebalance powers between lawmakers and judges in Myanmar the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: political party of deposed leader on sung-soo Chi will be dissolved for failing to re-register under a new electoral law according to the military controlled Electoral Commission the National League for democracy was among 40 political parties that failed to meet a deadline for an election. In November 2020, the NLD had won a landslide victory in the country's parliamentary elections, but less than three months later, the army carried out a coup and jailed Aung San Suu Kyi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The European Commission's transport department chief will resign from his post after it was revealed that he received free flights from Qatar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Heinrich Hollerley was facing an internal investigation after the revelation showed he accepted free flights from the Qatari government, while his team was negotiating a major aviation deal with the Gulf state's own airline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Surprisingly though, he'll continue working at the European Commission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: At his request, the college has decided to appoint Henry Kodalay, who is currently the director general for mobility and transport, to the position of Orklas Advisor, as the position is called in the Director General for International Partnerships, and that this decision is effective as of the 1st of April.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The revelations came after the European Parliament's very own corruption scandal involving Qatar, in which the Gulf state allegedly paid large sums of cash to EU lawmakers in return for influence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There's been no evidence to suggest that the European Commission was involved in this scandal, but transparency NGOs have widely criticized Brussels' ethics rules as weak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Hollalay's decision will come as a relief to the Commission, which was initially defending his choice to accept the free Qatar flights, since all his missions were within the rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But surprisingly, it was Hollerley himself that approved his own free flights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Some MEPs say that the Commission's response is unacceptable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Is it enough of a consequence if he is just moving from one job to another, basically keeping his same salary?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I don't think so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As far as I understand, there is still a disciplinary procedure ongoing. So that's up now to the commission services to determine that. But I think it clearly shows we cannot have director generals that authorize their own exception of free flights or gifts or whatever, independent oversight. And when the rules are broken, there need to be sanctions, not just a reshuffle where people move to another job with the same pay.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The E.U.'s watchdog has already asked the commission to provide details on business trips made by senior staff members since 2021 that were partly paid for by third parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A group of Swiss women whose average age is 73 is taking their government to the European Court of Human Rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Senior Women for Climate Protection group says Switzerland's climate policies are putting them at risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They say their rights to both life and health are being infringed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Switzerland doesn't deny that climate change can affect health, but it argues that emissions can't specifically be tied to the health of older women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And it says climate action is a matter for politicians to decide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The verdict could have important repercussions, not only for the 46 member states of the European Council but the whole world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: King Charles arrived in Germany on Wednesday, his first state visit abroad since becoming

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: British monarch. As part of efforts to turn the page on years of rocky relations between Britain and the European Union after its exit from the bloc. He had been due to travel to France first but cancelled it due to violent social unrest gri from the bloc. He had been due to travel to France first, but cancelled it due to violent social unrest gripping the streets there. gleich ein Hotel übernachten werden und was dann die Sicherheitsbestimmungen so sein werden, wird bestimmt spannend, ob wir ihn mal zu sehen kriegen oder nicht.

sentences.sentence: Er wird seine Sache sicher gut machen, anders wie seine Mutter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Und da warten wir mal ab, was auf uns zukommt in nächster Zeit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: This is the first state visit by a British Monarch in eight years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: And it will reinforce what Buckingham Palace called shared histories, culture and values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Tourists are flocking to see Michelangelo's David in Florence following an uproar in the US, after a principal was forced to resign over complaints about a lesson featuring the statue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: One parent in Florida called it pornography.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Two others said that they should have been notified before it was shown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: While in Italy, where the statue is housed, people expressed surprise over the controversy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This is so strange that the icon of the Renaissance could be called pornographic. You know, you have to distinguish between nudity and pornography, and this is absolutely not the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: American tourists are also lining up to see the statue, expressing disappointment that the dispute happened in the first place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I feel incredibly sorry for the children that don't get to see it from the principal's point of view. I think it's just sad and I'm very very I'm glad I don't live there. So I actually just saw the article about this and I just it's part of history. I don't understand how you can like say that it's porn, like pornographic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Over the weekend, both the mayor of Florence and the museum director where the statue is shown invited the principal and the school's community to come and see the famous artwork for themselves.
